USER QUERY:
Can you set the kitchen fan to run at speed level 3 and reverse the direction?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The fan speed ranges from 0 (off) to 5 levels. The direction can be either Forward or Reverse. To set speed, the command is Set Speed [SPD] with a parameter from 0 to 5. To change direction, the command is Set Direction [DIR] with enum values Forward [0] or Reverse [1].

The user wants speed level 3 and direction reversed. So, I will send Set Speed with parameter 3 and Set Direction with parameter Reverse (1).

Result: Execute Set Speed [SPD] with 3 and Set Direction [DIR] with Reverse [1] to configure the fan as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
I want to set the thermostat to cool mode and target 22.5 degrees Celsius. How do I do that?

I first identify the relevant properties and commands. The thermostat supports modes Off, Heat, Cool, and Auto, with corresponding enum values. The target temperature can be set between 10.0 and 30.0 °C. To change mode, use Set Mode [SM] with the enum parameter; to set temperature, use Set Temperature [ST] with a float parameter.

The user wants to set mode to Cool and target temperature to 22.5 °C. This means sending Set Mode with parameter Cool [2] and Set Temperature with 22.5.

Result: Send Set Mode [SM] with parameter 2 (Cool) and Set Temperature [ST] with 22.5 °C to configure the thermostat as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Please close the bedroom shade halfway and tilt the slats to 30 degrees.

Reviewing the device structure, the shade's position ranges from 0% (fully closed) to 100% (fully open). The tilt angle can be set between -90 and 90 degrees. Commands include Set Position [POS] with a percentage parameter and Set Tilt [STL] with degrees.

The user wants the shade closed halfway, which corresponds to 50% position (between fully closed and fully open). They also want the tilt angle set to 30 degrees.

Therefore, I will send Set Position with 50% and Set Tilt with 30 degrees.

Result: Execute Set Position [POS] with 50 and Set Tilt [STL] with 30 degrees to achieve the requested shade configuration.

  ***Properties***
    Door Status

        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPN]
    Close Door [CLS]
    Lock Door [LCK]
    Unlock Door [ULK]
    Query Status [QST]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [RDS]
    Report Lock Status [RLS]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door locked and closed right now?

The device has two relevant properties: Door Status (Closed, Open, Opening, Closing) and Lock Status (Locked, Unlocked). To determine the current state, the assistant can send Report Door Status [RDS] and Report Lock Status [RLS] commands.

Since the user asks if the door is locked and closed, I need to check if Door Status equals Closed [0] and Lock Status equals Locked [0].

Result: Query the device with Report Door Status and Report Lock Status commands. If Door Status is Closed and Lock Status is Locked, then the door is locked and closed; otherwise, it is not.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

Could you brighten the den night light to 75% and set the ramp rate to 4 minutes?

The den night light has properties for Status and On Level ranging from 0 to 100%, and a Ramp Rate property with enumerated values including 4.0 minutes [6]. The accepted commands include Brighten [BRT] (which adjusts brightness) and Ramp Rate [RR] (which sets the ramp rate with enum parameters).

The user wants to brighten the light to 75%, which is within the 0-100% range, and set the ramp rate to 4 minutes, corresponding to enum value [6].

To achieve this, I will send the Brighten command to increase brightness to 75% and Ramp Rate command with parameter 6 to set the ramp rate to 4 minutes.

Result: Execute Brighten [BRT] to reach 75% brightness and Ramp Rate [RR] with parameter 6 to set ramp rate to 4 minutes.

The device has a Timer property ranging from 0 to 120 minutes. The accepted command to set the timer is Set Timer [TMR] with a parameter in minutes.

To run the fan for 45 minutes, I will send Set Timer with parameter 45. The fan will then operate for that duration before turning off automatically.

What's the current temperature in the living room and can you switch the thermostat off?

The device has a Current Temperature property ranging from 5.0 to 35.0 °C. To get the current temperature, the assistant can send Report Temperature [RT]. To switch the thermostat off, the Set Mode [SM] command with parameter Off [0] is used.

First, I will query the current temperature by sending Report Temperature. Then, to turn off the thermostat, I will send Set Mode with parameter 0.

Result: Send Report Temperature [RT] to get the current temperature, then send Set Mode [SM] with parameter 0 to switch the thermostat off.

USER QUERY:
Can you stop the bedroom shade if it's moving and then open it fully?

The shade has a Status property with values Stopped [0] and Moving [1]. The commands include Stop [STP] to halt movement and Open [OPN] to open the shade fully.

First, I would check the Status property to see if the shade is moving. If it is moving, I will send the Stop command to halt it. Then, I will send the Open command to open the shade fully.

Result: If the shade is moving, send Stop [STP], then send Open [OPN] to open the shade fully.
